editor_decision.feedback: After careful deliberation, the editorial board has determined that your submission does not meet the journal's current standards. We encourage the authors to consider alternative venues. No further correspondence will be entered into regarding this decision. We thank you for your interest in the Annals of Conditions Under Which Peer Review Actually Functions.

issues.reason: I was unable to complete my review due to the density of the material, a departmental retreat, two grant deadlines, my child's school play, and a particularly engrossing season of television.
issues.required_fix: Please grant an additional 6-8 months for a thorough evaluation. I anticipate beginning my review in earnest sometime after my sabbatical.
issues.suggestion: Perhaps the editorial board could schedule a follow-up for late next year. I will be available on alternating Tuesdays between 2 and 3 PM, excluding holidays and days with nice weather.

residual_concerns: I only managed to read the title and part of the abstract.
The abstract looked fine from what I could tell, but I would not want to rush to judgment.
My schedule is fully committed through the end of the year and most of next year as well.

editor_decision.summary:
I have now read all submitted reviews. What follows is my candid assessment of the review process for this manuscript.

The reviewer assigned to 'Clarity & Rigor' has — after a delay that I can only describe as geological — informed me that they managed to read the title and part of the abstract before being called away by a departmental retreat, two grant deadlines, a child's school play, and (I am not making this up) 'a particularly engrossing season of television.' They request six to eight additional months, contingent on the completion of their sabbatical.

The reviewer assigned to 'Correctness & Completeness' has — after a delay that I can only describe as geological — informed me that they managed to read the title and part of the abstract before being called away by a departmental retreat, two grant deadlines, a child's school play, and (I am not making this up) 'a particularly engrossing season of television.' They request six to eight additional months, contingent on the completion of their sabbatical.

The reviewer assigned to 'Reference Validity' has — after a delay that I can only describe as geological — informed me that they managed to read the title and part of the abstract before being called away by a departmental retreat, two grant deadlines, a child's school play, and (I am not making this up) 'a particularly engrossing season of television.' They request six to eight additional months, contingent on the completion of their sabbatical.

I am rejecting this manuscript effective immediately — not on its mathematical merits, which remain unexamined, but because the review process itself has become untenable.
